precontext: John was dining at his favorite local café, enjoying a quiet meal. He chatted with the friendly staff who knew him well. As he finished his dessert, he stood up to leave.
sentence: After the meal, he accidentally tipped the table on his way out.
ending: He later received first aid from the staff and was fine to go back to work.
meanings_considered: cause to topple or tumble by pushing
give a tip or gratuity to in return for a service, beyond the compensation agreed on
explanation:
• "Tipped the table" in the context of dining and leaving is a common expression meaning to push or move the table, which fits the physical action of tipping it over.  
• The alternative meaning (giving a gratuity) is unlikely here because the sentence describes an accidental physical event, not a financial transaction.  
• The ending mentions that John received first aid due to the incident, which implies the table was knocked over, supporting the physical meaning and ruling out the gratuity interpretation.
clear_meaning_text: cause to topple or tumble by pushing
